Package gui

Class Gui

  • java.lang.Object
    • gui.Gui
  • public final class Gui
extends java.lang.Object
    The Gui class represents the GUI of the application. It is responsible for displaying the windowing pane, the windowing size, the windowing chosen size, the lines, the sliders, the text fields, the buttons, the menu items, and the toggle buttons.

    • Field Summary

      Fields

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void addEventHandlers​(javafx.scene.control.Slider slider, javafx.scene.control.TextField txtField, javafx.scene.control.Slider sliderSlave)
      It adds a listener to the slider's value property, which is a double, and when the value changes, it updates the text field with the new value, and also updates the min or max value of the slave slider
      void addEventHandlers​(javafx.scene.layout.AnchorPane pane)
      It adds event handlers to the scene's width and height properties, so that when the window is resized, the windowing size is updated accordingly
      void changeLineSize()
      For each line in the list of lines, set the stroke width to the current stroke width times the scale.
      void deactivateFocus()
      This removes focus from the selected windowing area
      void drawLineForFocus​(double x1, double y1, double x2, double y2)
      Draws a line on a graphics window using Cartesian coordinates.
      void drawLines​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Double[]> segments)
      This function draws the lines on the window pane.
      void eraseLines()
      It clears the linesPane and the lines ArrayList
      void init​(javafx.stage.Stage primaryStage, javafx.scene.Parent root)
      It sets up the GUI
      void openFile()
      It opens a file chooser, reads the file, and sets the window size
      void updateLines​(double scale)
      For each line in the list of lines, multiply the start and end x and y coordinates by the scale, and multiply the stroke width by the scale.

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public void init​(javafx.stage.Stage primaryStage,
                 javafx.scene.Parent root)
        It sets up the GUI
        Parameters:
        primaryStage - The stage that the windowing GUI will be displayed on.
        root - the root node of the scene graph

      • addEventHandlers

        public void addEventHandlers​(javafx.scene.layout.AnchorPane pane)
        It adds event handlers to the scene's width and height properties, so that when the window is resized, the windowing size is updated accordingly
        Parameters:
        pane - The pane that the windowing pane is in.

      • addEventHandlers

        public void addEventHandlers​(javafx.scene.control.Slider slider,
                             javafx.scene.control.TextField txtField,
                             javafx.scene.control.Slider sliderSlave)
        It adds a listener to the slider's value property, which is a double, and when the value changes, it updates the text field with the new value, and also updates the min or max value of the slave slider
        Parameters:
        slider - the slider that will be used to change the value of the text field
        txtField - The text field that will be updated with the slider's value.
        sliderSlave - the slider that will be affected by the change of the slider value.

      • openFile

        public void openFile()
        It opens a file chooser, reads the file, and sets the window size

      • deactivateFocus

        public void deactivateFocus()
        This removes focus from the selected windowing area

      • drawLines

        public void drawLines​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Double[]> segments)
        This function draws the lines on the window pane.
        Parameters:
        segments - The segments parameter is an ArrayList of Double arrays that represent the segments that are to be drawn on the window pane.

      • drawLineForFocus

        public void drawLineForFocus​(double x1,
                             double y1,
                             double x2,
                             double y2)
        Draws a line on a graphics window using Cartesian coordinates.
        Parameters:
        x1 - the x-coordinate of the starting point of the line
        y1 - the y-coordinate of the starting point of the line
        x2 - the x-coordinate of the ending point of the line
        y2 - the y-coordinate of the ending point of the line

      • eraseLines

        public void eraseLines()
        It clears the linesPane and the lines ArrayList

      • updateLines

        public void updateLines​(double scale)
        For each line in the list of lines, multiply the start and end x and y coordinates by the scale, and multiply the stroke width by the scale.
        Parameters:
        scale - The scale to multiply the lines by.

      • changeLineSize

        public void changeLineSize()
        For each line in the list of lines, set the stroke width to the current stroke width times the scale.
